definitions: intended to distract attention from something more important

examples.text: her comments are easy to dismiss as a diversionary tactic
He planned to confuse the enemy with a diversionary attack on the Alaskan coast

shortDefinitions: intended to distract attention from something more important

definitions: denoting a recreational activity that diverts the mind

examples.text: a coffee break and diversionary chat with Paul
a major issue in urban areas is that of accessible diversionary activities for young people

shortDefinitions: denoting recreational activity that diverts mind

definitions: having the effect of turning something aside from its course

examples.text: the challenge of lowering the lake isn't just technical—diversionary tunnels could drain it

shortDefinitions: having effect of turning something aside from its course

definitions: denoting an alternative route for use by traffic when the usual road is temporarily closed

examples.text: motorists are advised to follow the signed diversionary route

shortDefinitions: denoting alternative route for use by traffic when usual road is temporarily closed
